articles.description: Honey bees can normally keep their hives perfectly climate-controlled, but extreme heat can overwhelm their defenses. During a scorching Arizona summer, researchers found that high temperatures caused damaging temperature fluctuations inside hives, leading to population declines. Smaller colonies we

articles.title: Scientists discover what’s linking floods and droughts across the planet
articles.description: Scientists tracking Earth’s water from space discovered that El Niño and La Niña are synchronizing floods and droughts across continents. When these climate cycles intensify, far-apart regions can become unusually wet or dangerously dry at the same time. The study also found a global shift about a d

articles.title: Who will be the Ottawa Redblacks' starting QB in 2026? Hint: Initials are S.Q.
articles.description: Ottawa Redblacks head coach Ryan Dinwiddie told reporters that Dru Brown will "absolutely" be the team's No. 1 signal caller

articles.title: This new sugar tastes like the real thing without the usual downsides
articles.description: Scientists at Tufts have found a way to turn common glucose into a rare sugar that tastes almost exactly like table sugar—but with far fewer downsides. Using engineered bacteria as microscopic factories, the team can now produce tagatose efficiently and cheaply, achieving yields far higher than curr

articles.title: Mark Carney leads delegation to Prince Rupert to discuss major projects with B.C. Coastal First Nations
articles.description: Federal representatives attempt to smooth over relations with Coastal First Nations leaders, who were angered at not being consulted in Ottawa's energy agreement with Alberta.

articles.description: Trial opens with constitutional challenge of a publicly funded Catholic hospital's right to be exempted from providing medical assistance in dying under Canada's Charter of Rights, after Sam O'Neill was moved to hospice in 2023

articles.title: Scientists identify secret ingredient in Leonardo da Vinci paintings
articles.description: "Old Masters" such as Leonardo da Vinci, Sandro Botticelli and Rembrandt may have used proteins, especially egg yolk, in their oil paintings, according to a new study.

articles.title: Silicon Valley Bank collapse renews calls to address disparities impacting entrepreneurs of color
articles.description: When customers at Silicon Valley Bank rushed to withdraw billions of dollars last month, venture capitalist Arlan Hamilton stepped in to help some of the founders of color who panicked about losing access to payroll funds.

articles.description: As the US attempts to wean itself off its heavy reliance on fossil fuels and shift to cleaner energy sources, many experts are eyeing a promising solution: your neighborhood big-box stores and shopping malls.
